basics.label: Assistant Professor & Ph.D. Scholar in Mathematics
basics.summary: I am a curious and thoughtful individual who values knowledge, integrity, and meaningful connections. With a calm and analytical mindset, I approach life with patience and a desire to understand the world deeply. I enjoy exploring new ideas, solving challenging problems, and engaging in creative thinking. My interests extend beyond academics to technology, nature, and meaningful conversations. I appreciate honesty, mutual respect, and kindness in people. In my free time, I enjoy reading, learning new skills, and reflecting on personal growth. I believe in continuous self‑improvement and strive to balance professional ambition with a grounded and compassionate outlook on life.

work.name: Jadavpur University
work.position: Ph.D. Scholer in the Department of Mathematics
work.summary: I explore the fascinating world of wave propagation in smart and complex composite materials, focusing on piezoelectric fiber‑reinforced composites and their interaction with elastic, viscoelastic, and fluid layers. My work blends mathematical modeling and advanced computation to unlock how material properties, interfaces, and external fields influence wave speed, energy flow, and damping. These insights power innovations in earthquake engineering, geophysical exploration, and next‑generation smart material design. By merging theory, simulation, and creativity, I aim to transform abstract equations into real‑world solutions that advance both science and technology.

work.name: Brainware University
work.summary: Teaching undergraduate and postgraduate mathematics courses while engaging in active research in solid mechanics, wave propagation, and piezoelectric materials. Mentoring students in research projects, guiding academic growth, and contributing to departmental academic development. Integrating research insights into classroom teaching to enhance learning outcomes and foster scientific curiosity.
highlights: Teaching Mathematics to Undergraduate and Postgraduate Students

confarenes.name: International Conference on Mathematics and Its Applications (ICMA 2024)
confarenes.summary: Presented research on wave propagation in smart composite structures, focusing on piezoelectric fiber-reinforced composites and interfacial imperfections. Discussed exact dispersion relations, phase velocity variations, and damping effects in layered systems.
highlights: Showcased theoretical modeling and computational analysis

confarenes.name: National Seminar on Advances in Mathematics and Its Applications
confarenes.summary: Presented work on mathematical modeling of SH-wave propagation in layered composite structures. Discussed implications for earthquake engineering and smart material design.
highlights: Presented poster and participated in Q&A session
Engaged with experts in solid mechanics and applied mathematics

publications.name: The Influence of SH-wave Propagation in a Tri-layered Composite Structure with Interfacial Imperfections
publications.summary: This research investigates the effects of interfacial imperfections on shear-horizontal (SH) wave propagation in a tri-layered composite structure. By deriving exact dispersion relations and analyzing wave behavior, the study reveals how material properties, interface conditions, and geometric parameters influence phase velocity and damping characteristics, offering insights for applications in material engineering and wave-based sensing.

projects.name: Morse Theory-A tool to study topological structure of smooth manifold.
projects.summary: Morse Theory is a mathematical tool used to study the topological structure of smooth manifolds. This project explored the critical points of smooth functions on manifolds and their relationship to topology, providing insights into manifold theory and its applications in geometry and mathematical physics. Supervised by Satyabrota Kundu.
highlights: Studied topological structures of smooth manifolds
Applied Morse Theory to analyze critical points and topology
